definitions.definition: To produce offspring sexually; to bear young.
To give birth to; to be the native place of.
definitions.example: a pond breeds fish; a northern country breeds stout men

definitions.definition: To keep animals and have them reproduce in a way that improves the next generation’s qualities.
To arrange the mating of specific animals.
definitions.example: She wanted to breed her cow to the neighbor's registered bull.

definitions.definition: To propagate or grow plants trying to give them certain qualities.
definitions.example: He tries to breed blue roses.

definitions.definition: To take care of in infancy and through childhood; to bring up.

definitions.example: disaster breeds famine;  familiarity breeds contempt

definitions.definition: To be formed in the parent or dam; to be generated, or to grow, like young before birth.
(sometimes as breed up) To educate; to instruct; to bring up
To produce or obtain by any natural process.
To have birth; to be produced, developed or multiplied.
